title: Maureen Lipman on Coronation Street spoilers: 'It's like asking Boris about Jennifer Arcuri'
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

When it comes to dishing out spoilers, soap stars tend to be well trained on what they can or can’t say – and there was no persuading thespian icon Maureen Lipman to part with any Coronation Street storyline details when we chatted to her at the recent Inside Soap Awards.

In fact, the Best Newcomer winner joked that it’s ‘like asking Boris Johnson if he was intimate with that American woman’, referring to the Jennifer Arcuri situation. Amid questioning over whether Arcuri gained government funding due to a closeness to the Prime Minister, Boris has remained tight lipped.

And Maureen is just as cagey when it comes to soap spoilers!

She told Metro.co.uk: ‘I can’t say anything, I know that’s what you’d like but it’s a bit like asking Boris is he was intimate with the American woman!’

However, she was persuaded to part with one small morsel as she hinted that there were confrontational scenes ahead thanks to sinister new nanny Jade, who appears to have it in for Fiz.

Maureen said: ‘Things get very tight with the nanny and combatative with Fiz and Tyrone so we’re playing that at the moment – I call it Confrontation Street.’

But while Maureen is having a blast at Coronation Street, there is one thing that she has to suspend logic for – the sleeping arrangements chez Dobbs.

She smiled: ‘I don’t know where we all sleep – we must be sleeping top to tail! And the dog is big! It’s like a Tardis that house – you don’t question these things too quickly. Evelyn is established now in the Street and even people who don’t like her begrudgingly respect that she can tell them they’re not very nice to their face!

‘I am really happy that the viewers picked me for their award – it really should be best latecomer after doing this for 52 years! But I think I am showing that this old dog has a few new tricks. I love being part of the company, I feel very loved in Manchester and it feels very organic to be here with my husband having written 250 episodes and myself having watched episode one.’
